properties.name: Thornton Beach
properties.description: Easy water access with long pools and runs. There is good water above and below the bridge.

properties.name: Gilmores Bridge
properties.description: One of the most popular stretches of the river, Gilmores Bridge has a fantastic mix of water and fishes well in high and low water.

properties.name: The Breakaway
properties.description: There is heaps of water above and below the Breakaway bridge, it has a good mix of weed, runs, pools and sections of broken water.

properties.name: Willow Grove Boat Ramp
properties.description: Boat ramp, but also a very good shoreline to walk and fish for trout. This is a nice protected shoreline in a southerly.

properties.name: Tanjil River Arm
properties.description: The Tanjil arm is full of timber and is a fantastic area to target bass in the summer.

properties.name: Dam Wall Boat Ramp
properties.description: The dam wall boat ramp, there are some good soaks to the west that hold good numbers of fish.

properties.name: Deepwater TSR
properties.description: Located just upstream of the New England Hwy bridge, off Bezzants Road. Travelling Stock Routes (TSRs) provide convenient access points along this river.

properties.name: Deepwater TSR
properties.description: Located approximately 10km north of Deepwater on the New England Highway. Travelling Stock Routes (TSRs) provide convenient access points along this river.

properties.name: Ebor Falls Pool
properties.description: For the more athletic amongst us, the pool below the first of Ebor’s twin waterfalls can provide some great fishing.

properties.name: Ebor Common
properties.description: There is fantastic access right in the heart of town, through the Ebor Common. Access is best via Parke Street: look for the gate next to the stockyards.

properties.name: Broodstock Release
properties.description: Often ex-DPI hatchery broodstock are released for the October Long Weekend in the pools under the Waterfall Way bridge.

properties.name: Cowpaddock Bay
properties.description: Great bay with rocks and weed, this bay is known for it’s mayfly hatches.

properties.name: Seven Pound Bay
properties.description: A nice shallow rocky and weedy bay that fishes well by boat or land based.

properties.name: Pumphouse Bay
properties.description: A nice weedy bay with some timber, easy access to the lake close to the main road.

properties.name: Cressy Road
properties.description: Flat water and the easiest access, from here you may walk upstream or downstream and encounter rising fish.

properties.name: Fisheries Lane
properties.description: Access to weir 1 where there is great sight fishing for cruising and rising fish.

properties.name: Lonnavale Rd
properties.description: Wide open sections of runs, deep pools, boulders and pockets. There is days of fishing to be had through this section.

properties.name: Lower Estuarine Area
properties.description: Below Huonville here you will find sea trout following and feeding on the baitfish. A boat can be very helpful when fishing this section.

properties.name: Lake Burbury Camping Ground
properties.description: Good shore based access and a boat ramp providing the best access to the northern part of the lake.

properties.name: Mount Jukes Road
properties.description: Fantastic shore based fishing and features a boat ramp north of the Darwin Dam

properties.name: Road Shore
properties.description: Lovely weed beds, some rocks, a good mayfly spinner shoreline. When the water is high you can see tailing trout along the shoreline.

properties.name: Untouchables Shore
properties.description: A nice grassy shoreline with weed. This area all the way along the shore to the north is a great spot for tailing trout.

properties.name: Cricket Pitch / Shack Shore
properties.description: A fantastic shore based spot by day or evening. It is very common to find rising fish along this shoreline mopping up mayfly.

properties.name: Macquarie Road
properties.description: Nice flat water where you can walk the south east bank and encounter rising fish.

properties.name: Barton Road
properties.description: A typical section of the Macquarie, this area features both wide sections with shallow margins and narrow sections. This is great mix of water for the fly angler.

properties.name: Cressy
properties.description: Deeper water but with some flow created by the weir. This area holds some big brown trout.

properties.name: Meander Town
properties.description: A nice mix of flatter water below the bridge providing good dry fly fishing and above the bridge pocket water lending itself to both dry fly and nymph fishing.

properties.name: Long Ridge Road
properties.description: A mix of runs and pools with a few sections of large boulders and pocket water.

properties.name: Cheshunt Road Bridge
properties.description: Beautiful runs and pools perfectly suited for dry fly and nymph below dry fishing.

properties.name: Blue Gums
properties.description: Angler access to a section of the Meander that has continuous glides and pools where rising fish can often be found.

properties.name: Liena
properties.description: A lovely open section of fast flowing  and relatively shallow water perfectly suited to nymph and dry fly fishing.

properties.name: Latrobe
properties.description: A very good section of river for early and late season. It features long runs and pools.

properties.name: Merseylea
properties.description: Fantastic all round water that gives anglers the opportunity to fish nymphs, dries, wets and streamers.

properties.name: Corra Lynn
properties.description: A nice freestone section of water close to town that fishes well early season.

properties.name: Blessington Road
properties.description: Fantastic angler access thanks to land owners and IFS. Large amounts of nice running water and pools. Beware that it be a little tight in some sections.

properties.name: Boat Ramp
properties.description: Boat launching facility providing convenient access to the lake.

properties.name: Pine River Inlet
properties.description: Very accessible shoreline for casting from the bank. Rising fish can often be found in this shallow bay.

properties.name: Perth
properties.description: Below the weir there is nice flowing water, weed beds and flat water where you will encounter rising fishing.

properties.name: Evandale
properties.description: A mix of shallow water holding smaller fish and deep water with some very nice sized brown trout. Good mayfly hatches and hopper fishing can occur here.

properties.name: Clarendon House
properties.description: Angler access via Clarendon House and the Australian Fly Fishing Museum. This area has lovely flat water with lush weed beds and plenty of rising fish.

properties.name: Nunamara
properties.description: Pools and shallow riffles that are very typical of the St Patricks River.

properties.name: Corkerys Road
properties.description: Very good water with runs, riffles and pools. A mix of tight/ intimate water and open flatter water.

properties.name: Targa Hill Road
properties.description: Overgrown and pokey water for the angler who enjoys fishing with a shorter rod. There are some very nice fish through this area.

properties.name: Mt Field
properties.description: A lovely section of river at the base of Mt Field National Park, it holds big numbers of small to medium sized brown trout.

properties.name: Westerway
properties.description: One of the most popular areas to fish and for good reason. There is a great mix or dry fly and nymph fishing here.

properties.name: Eddy Road
properties.description: A deep flat section, however there are runs above and below this access point.

properties.name: Track access
properties.description: A walk is required to get to the river, but it well worth it with a nice mix of water above and below.

properties.name: Woolshed Bay
properties.description: A nice bay with gradually sloping shorelines with grass, rocks and sand. There is also a boat ramp located at the northern and souther points of the bay.

properties.name: Picnic Point
properties.description: Around the Picnic Point area there are a mix of grassy shorelines, rocky points and standing and fallen timber. There is also a boat ramp located here.

properties.name: Springhill Road bridge
properties.description: Medium - slow paced water suited to dry and nymph below dry.

properties.name: Bourke Street
properties.description: Probably the most popular fishing location on the lake, there is a nice embankment allowing access to the water and good casting room.

properties.name: Southern shore point
properties.description: A good example of a nice point and drop off to search around or look for moving fish.

properties.name: Hazeldene
properties.description: A nice mix of fast and medium paced water suitable for dry fly or nymph fishing.

properties.name: Fyans Inlet Channel
properties.description: A gradual shoreline suitable for wading with submerged trees and reeds where mouching trout can often be found.

properties.name: The Swamp/Marsh
properties.description: The shallow marshy area at the southern end of the lake provides sum on the best fishing, it has a great mix of weed beds, rocks, reeds and tussocks.

properties.name: The Quarry
properties.description: The eastern shoreline has great water for the shore based angler, it is wadable, but the fish cruise the weed edges close to the shore here.

properties.name: The South West Platforms
properties.description: Fishing platforms and a nice walkable shoreline.

properties.name: Eastern Shoreline
properties.description: The eastern shoreline is a nice weedy and rocky shoreline with heaps of water and good fishing.

properties.name: South Eastern Bays
properties.description: The south eastern area of the lake provides some of the most reliable boat based fishing.

properties.name: Ballarat Fly Fishers Club
properties.description: Formed in 1919 the BFFC is one of the oldest fly clubs in Australia.

properties.name: Western Shoreline
properties.description: The western shoreline has nice gradually sloping banks where plenty of trout cruise. This is great dry fly and wet fly water.

properties.name: King River Arm
properties.description: The river arm can be very good in Autumn and through winter as fish begin pushing up getting ready to spawn in the river.

properties.name: The Poplars Camp Ground
properties.description: Small and tight water with lots of small brown trout.

properties.name: Gunns Road
properties.description: Typical small Loch River water.

properties.name: Cobungra Track
properties.description: A typical mix of runs, pools and fast flowing broken water.

properties.name: Big River
properties.description: A great example of typical Big River water. It lends itself to both nymph and dry fly fishing.

properties.name: Eastern Shore
properties.description: Nice grassy and rocky shoreline with plenty go good weed beds.

properties.name: Northern Shore
properties.description: A good rocky shoreline with some grass near the car park, this area has good rising fish in the evening in light winds.

properties.name: Bright
properties.description: Fantastic dry and nymph below dry water close to town. This section holds a larger number of fish.

properties.name: Tawonga Gap Road Bridge
properties.description: Nice shallow running dry fly water. This little section and further upstream can be a bit tight at times.

properties.name: Northern Point
properties.description: A good example of a rocky shore and point that produces fish by bank or boat.

properties.name: Eastern Point
properties.description: Another good rocky shoreline and point that is easy to access from the bank.

properties.name: Tumbling Water
properties.description: Good runs and pools, perfectly suiting to dry fly and nymph fishing. A great spot for a quick fish with the family.

properties.name: Kendalls Campground
properties.description: A beautiful section flowing through forest featuring many boulders, this is a great section for those who don’t mind some trees and complex currents.
Consistent stretch of runs, pools and riffles - great hopper fishing in the warmer months.
properties.name: Rubicon Rd
Buxton
properties.description: Nice flowing water in the middle of town. Perfectly suited to dry and nymph fishing.

properties.name: Buxton-Marysville Road Bridge
properties.description: Great runs, pools and pocket water above and below the bridge.

properties.name: Falls Camp Ground 1
properties.description: High gradient flowing water with nice boulders and pockets. This area has great nymphing and summer dry fly fishing

properties.name: Lower Toorongo
properties.description: A typically section of the river flowing through farmland. Suited to dry and nymph below dry fishing.
Despite becoming close to town, a beautiful section with runs, pockets and nice pools all holding good numbers of fish.
properties.name: Warburton Upper
Little Peninsular Tunnel
properties.description: A nice piece of water holding good numbers of fish, the river is a littler smaller and more overgrown up here when compared to the Warburton area.

properties.name: Thredbo Village
properties.description: The ultimate in 'gentrified' fly fishing with productive water right through the village and up past the golf course.

properties.name: Cascade Trail
properties.description: Great twigwater into the Thredbo headwaters with frisky rainbows eager to take a dry in summer.

properties.name: Thredbo Diggings
properties.description: The gradient slows here with big pools.

properties.name: Lake Crackenback/Ski Tube
properties.description: Long riffles, glides and runs can be found following the riverside track downstream.
